summary: The Peer to Peer Mental Health Support Act aims to establish a pilot program for evidence-based mental health peer support activities for secondary school students. The Assistant Secretary for Mental Health and Substance Use, in consultation with the Secretary of Education, will administer the program, awarding grants to eligible entities (states, territories, etc.) to implement peer support initiatives. The bill mandates evaluation of the program's effectiveness, a report to relevant congressional committees, and technical assistance for participating entities. The program sunsets on September 30, 2029.
